review_title: Assisting people in the materials library and what it upholds
pros:
-Exposure to different materials
-Exposure to the trending materials 
-Learning different machinery to excel in different materials used
cons: -Needs more time to learn all of the materials
Lack of morale, lack of investment in professional development and career advancement for professors

review_title: Probably the best job I will ever have
pros:
This art & design school is a hidden gem in the Middle East (associated with home campus in USA). The school is well funded and growing each year. The country is developing at the speed of light - rare for universities now days. Plus, for faculty it offers:
- Generous benefit package
- Supportive environment
- Wonderful students
- Unlimited opportunities for growth
cons:
Very hot in the summer (Middle East)
Confusing governmental regulations and bureaucracy
Terrible driving habits - dangerous drivers
Poor treatment of low-skilled laborers

review_title: VCUQatar, living in Qatar on a small off-site campus.
pros: Friendly people, great pay, great creative opportunities, travel, collaborations, numerous grants available.
cons: It's very hot, and the culture is very different from the US.  You have to be adventurous and open-minded to work here. At this point, we only have one year renewable contracts with no chance for tenure.  But many people have worked here for more than a decade.

pros: Great benefits, good co-workers, good culture
cons: Dead weight that requires some political skill to navigate
